title: New Win11 Laptop Install of Thunderbird and "Settings" will not show
content:
Hello, I just finished installing all my tools and such on my new laptop (Dell 7780). The laptop is Win 11 Pro with all updates for 24H2. I installed Thunderbird (128.3.2esr 64bit). I have used Thunderbird for over 20 years or so. I know how to move profiles, etc. Well, I moved my profiles from old laptop to new laptop and everything was working fine.

Today, I tried to go into Thunderbird Settings (NOT Account Settings). if I go through the menu Tools \ Settings. Nothing happens. Use the ||| on the taskbar, NOTHING HAPPENS. Open "Account Settings" and go down to * Thunderbird Settings, NOTHING HAPPENS. Tried using Troubleshooting and restart with no change.

I also reverted back to the original Profile that was the default when it installed. I then imported from my other profile saved off. Same deal, cannot open Settings. (Tried before Import and after).

What have I done wrong? What can I try and massage to get the window to show?

Thanks,

Joe
creator: jkaisler

title: OAuth2 for IMAP/SMTP Bug - Not Challenged for Credentials
content:
I've used Thunderbird with multiple Google Workspace accounts before - but I've found the account configuration process to be very inconsistent.

All three accounts require OAuth2 authentication - all use the same IMAP and SMTP servers.

Adding the first account works perfectly - every time. It's when I go to add the second account that I start encountering issues.

I'll see one of two things happen:

1. A browser window will instantiate but it will attempt to use the login from the first account to authenticate the mailbox for the second account. Obviously that's not going to work, so I cancelled out of the authentication workflow.

2. Now that I've cancelled the authentication workflow, Thunderbird attempts to use basic auth each and every time. I've deleted the account and tried adding it back again. No luck.

I've had this working on a couple of other Windows computers. But, as mentioned at the onset, the behavior was very inconsistent.

Now, I'm setting up a new computer and I'm stuck.

From what I've seen in other email clients - they seem to understand that each mailbox will require unique credentials.

They do not attempt to reuse OAuth2 tokens for subsequent mailboxes. Instead, they restart the authentication workflow for each account - which is the behavior I would expect with Thunderbird as well.

This seems like a bug. I'm not sure how to troubleshoot it any further.

This is with version 128.3.2esr on Windows 11 (24H2).
creator: jeff275

title: Problemi visualizzazione mail
content: Salve, da qualche giorno Thunderbird ha iniziato ad aprirmi alcune mail come vuote (che però erano visualizzabili su altri pc). Ho disinstallato e reinstallato, ma ora ha perso ogni formattazione (oltre a continuare a non vedere quelle mail): i modelli li vede tutti senza formattazione (sia firma, che font, in alcuni aggiunge anche a capo che non c'erano), quando invio le mail formattate poi le salva nella posta inviata senza formattazione (font di base, asterischi al posto dei colori etc). Da un altro pc le mail che ho inviato si vedono formattate come le vedevo io quando le ho inviate. Quando faccio "nuovo messaggio" o "rispondi" la formattazione della firma c'è. Come posso risolvere?
creator: info7357

title: Problema con l'importazione delle impostazioni desktop su Thunderbird per Android
content:
Ciao a tutti,

Sto cercando di importare le mie configurazioni di Thunderbird dalla versione desktop (su Mac e Windows) alla versione mobile su Android. Ho seguito la guida ufficiale (https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/thunderbird-android-import), che indica di andare su "Strumenti > Esportazione mobile" dal desktop. Tuttavia, non riesco a trovare questa opzione, vedo solo "Esporta", che mi permette di generare un file ZIP di configurazione.

Ho provato entrambe le versioni stabile e release di Thunderbird, pensando che la funzione potesse essere presente solo in una versione specifica o beta, ma senza successo.

Qualcuno ha avuto lo stesso problema o può indicarmi se questa funzione è stata rinominata o se c'è un altro metodo per importare le configurazioni su Android?

Grazie mille per l'aiuto!
creator: gagginaspinnata

title: Migrate Tbird from one PC to another, e.g., duplicate it on both
content:
Long time T-bird user. Recently switched from Beta to the standard version and am pleased. Copied the old Profile to the new installation like a dream using a thumb drive on 1st pc. I've done this many times over the years. This week? Not a chance!

I uninstalled the Beta from 2nd pc and installed the latest T-bird, the same version as the one on 1st pc installed 2 days earlier. When I copied the profile from 1st to 2nd, it said it couldn't find it. Uninstalled and re-installed T-bird several times. Copied the profiles over and over. No way! Something about the new version seems to be adverse to doing things the old way. I'm stumped. I have completely removed T-bird from 2nd pc and taking a break. May try going back to the Beta version and see what happens.

Thoughts?

title: Many messages unreadable, body of message shows wall of text of a PDF file (not an attachment)
content:
I'm trying to track down a very odd issue on one of the workstations in my office. Sometimes an email will arrive and instead of showing the text of the email, it displays 56 pages of text that begin like this:

=_Part_5797826_2010012192.1704818235212

Content-Type: application/pdf Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64 Content-Disposition: attachment; filename="Archiectural Permit 

set_Revised_09.28.22.pdf"

Content-ID: <9909AC58-E8C2-43F5-8E05-7489A5543193>

JVBERi0xLjYKJeLjz9MKMiAwIG9iajw8L0ZpbHRlci9GbGF0ZURlY29kZS9MZW5ndGggMzk4NDI+ PgpzdHJlYW0KaN7sm03PJzuP1vf9Ke41Ut9UnMRxPsFISCxGLFggVgeGBp1GGljw9Ynty/XqOt3n 4WHgmWn1ou/flXrxv5KyU4n9j1/Kx3/9+NJk+6z8MSp/Cn98Dvmo8tnl43/8571p/TfImqjQZzk1 zSmLLyf9+3/18d+/bB/UJ31u9aMMko+vSta42srHf/nyr//u363//mdyc5rzU+zYf/jy99djxzq2...

When this happens, it's always this old PDF file that says it's an attachment, but there is no attachment, just this wall of text. I have no idea where to begin troubleshooting this, the only thing I can come up with is to delete everything and start clean, hopefully there's a better solution (like rebuild some database, if that's a thing). It is not always from the same sender but the attachment it refers to is always this one.
creator: jkamis

title: Rich Text Support For Thunderbird Mac Version
content:
Hello, Please, please can you make Thunderbird support RTF Rich Text Format, in addition to the plain text and .eml formats that Apple Mail supports? Can you make the user interface of Thunderbird appear more like Apple Mail? I made a $10.00 donation to you when I first dowloaded and launched Thunderbird on a newly setup Mac Mini with Sonoma 14.7 on Sunday. I've been running a 2012 Macbook Pro 13" with a 2.5GHz Dual Core i5, Mac OS Catalina 10.15 for years.

My e-mail provider, Rogers quit supporting standalone e-mail apps like Apple Mail in April 2023. But I managed to get it going on Thunderbird on Sunday. GMail works with Apple Mail and Thunderbird. GMail only needs the more secure versions of Apple Mail after 13.0. I was using Apple Mail for a decade with my rogers.com e-mail, but Rogers doesn't support new installations of e-mail apps after April 2023, so they force everyone to go to webmail, which I dislike. I use Outlook at work.

Dave.stuhl@rogers.com and dave.stuhl05@gmail.com
creator: dave.stuhl05

title: Thunderbird and POP/SMTP protocol for outlook.com email accounts post-Sept 2024
content:
I've used POP protocol in Outlook Mail app for years to download, manage and archive emails. As of Sept 2024 Microsoft switched to "modern authentication" and terminated POP protocol for outlook.com mail accounts in the Outlook Mail app. That means there's no way to download and back up emails locally. Outlook Mail still supports POP for other email clients like gmail but I'm hoping to avoid the hassle of switching my email accounts.

My question: will POP protocol still work in Thunderbird for outlook.com email accounts following Microsoft's switch to "modern authentication", or will Microsoft's system now block Thunderbird from downloading outlook.com emails?
creator: md.uva

title: The Mark as Solved button does not work - but your advice did the trick.  Thank you so much!

title: Multiple issues: Cannot repair subfolder, unable to download more than one file at a time, Filter will not run due to Error,
content:
1) Unable to download more than one file from server. 2) Unable to move files to subfolders using Run Filter. Receive error message: "The messages could not be moved or copied to folder 'Archive/2020-2029/2024 on Local Folders' because writing to folder failed. To gain disk space, from the File menu, first choose Empty Trash, and then choose Compact Folders, and then try again" 3) Unable to repair one subfolder. Cannot move files to it manually. 4) Cannot move multiple files to archive subfolders manually.

I have emptied Trash, run Compact, and Repair Folder on all subfolders.

Please advise.
creator: jdewey01

title: Adding Gmail Account to Thunderbird NOT Working
content:
I've tried to confirgure my Gmail account to Thunderbird multiple times recently, but not successfully getting it figured out. I'm always given a 400 error message and I can't figure out the root cause. I've updated and redownloaded TB and reset my Gmail password.

I've included screenshots to verify what I've got currently setup in TB and my Gmail settings. Anyone have this problem or have the solution? I have 3 other mail accounts that are not hosted by Google that work fine.
creator: firefox.o9y91

title: Unwanted Junk and Spam Filtering
content:
Persistent issue. I have now UNCHECKED (UK = unticked) EVERY BOX in the JUNK setings - both GLOBALLY - and for all 9 of my email account settings. Also cleared the "learning" memory.

TB still occassionally intercepts inbox mail and routes to other folders as junk or spam. Odd, but it is often frequently used email of my own origin, or from others on in my address book, but sometimes it actually is junk or spam.

I invest tremendous time in building the filter list and do not want TB to do anything other than follow THAT list.

I will reiterate a post comment that there needs to be an option to have ONE MASTER FILTER LIST to apply to all email accounts.

No image attached. If you don't know what the JUNK settings screen looks like ..... you are very probably NOT a person that should answer this.
creator: mminieri
